This module exposes parts of the LLVM library as a C API.

This modules provide an interface to libLLVMCore, which implements the LLVM intermediate representation as well as other related types and utilities.

Many exotic languages can interoperate with C code but have a harder time with C++ due to name mangling. So in addition to C, this interface enables tools written in such languages.

/ External users depend on the following values being stable. It is not safe / to reorder them.These are similar to the above functions except they operate on the global context.

A basic block represents a single entry single exit section of code. Basic blocks contain a list of instructions which form the body of the block.

Basic blocks belong to functions. They have the type of label.

Basic blocks are themselves values. However, the C API models them as LLVMBasicBlockRef.

Terminators

Imports

../raw, types

Procs

proc newContext(): Context {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Create a new context.

Contexts are execution states for the core LLVM IR system.

Most types are tied to a context instance. Multiple contexts can exist simultaneously. A single context is not thread safe. However, different contexts can execute on different threads simultaneously.

Wrapping:

  • contextCreate()
proc globalContext(): Context {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
proc newModule(name: string; cxt: Context = nil): Module {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Create a new, empty module in a specific context.

If cxt is nil, created module consists in the global cnotext.

This is equivalent to calling newModule(name, getGlobalContext())

Wrapping:

  • moduleCreateWithName(cstring)
  • moduleCreateWithNameInContext(cstring, ContextRef)

proc addFunction(self: Module; name: string; fnty: FunctionType): FunctionValue {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}

Add a function to a module under a specified name.

Wrapping:

  • addFunction(Moduleref, cstring, TypeRef)

Examples:

import
  llvm

var
  `mod` = newModule("main")
  fnty = functionType(voidType(), @[])
  fn = `mod`.addFunction("test", fnty)
assert $`mod` ==
    """; ModuleID = 'main'
source_filename = "main"

declare void @test()
"""
proc kind(self: Type): TypeKind {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Obtain the enumerated type of a Type instance.

Wrapping:

  • getTypeKind(TypeRef)

Examples:

from llvm / raw import getTypeKind

var llInt = intType(113)
assert llInt.kind == llInt.typ.getTypeKind()
proc isSized(self: Type): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Examples:

assert intType(113).isSized
assert not voidType().isSized
assert not functionType(voidType(), @[]).isSized

proc intType(cxt: Context; nbits: uint): IntegerType {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Obtain an integer type from the global context with a specified bit width.

Wrapping:

  • intTypeInContext(cuint)

Examples:

var
  cxt = globalContext()
  llInt = cxt.intType(113)
assert $llInt == "i113"
proc intType(nbits: uint): IntegerType {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Obtain an integer type from the global context with a specified bit width.

Wrapping:

  • intType(cuint)

Examples:

var llInt = intType(113)
assert $llInt == "i113"
proc functionType(retTy: Type; paramTypes: openArray[Type]; isVarArg: bool = false): FunctionType {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}

Obtain a function type consisting of a specified signature.

The function is defined as a tuple of a return Type, a list of parameter types, and whether the function is variadic.

Wrapping:

  • functionType(TypeRef, ptr TypeRef, cuint, Bool)

Examples:

var fnty = functionType(voidType(), (@[Type intType(64), intType(32)]))
assert $fnty == "void (i64, i32)"

Examples:

var fnty = functionType(intType(32), @[])
assert $fnty == "i32 ()"
proc voidType(): VoidType {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Create a void type in the global context.

Wrapping:

  • voidType()

Examples:

var llVoid = voidType()
assert $llVoid == "void"

proc constInt(intTy: IntegerType; n: int; signExtend: bool = false): Value {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}

Obtain a constant value for an integer type.

The returned value corresponds to a llvm::ConstantInt.

@see llvm::ConstantInt::get()

@param IntTy Integer type to obtain value of.

@param N The value the returned instance should refer to.

@param SignExtend Whether to sign extend the produced value.

Wrapping:

  • constInt(TypeRef, ulonglong, Bool)
proc newGlobal(module: Module; typ: Type; name: string): GlobalVariable {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Wrapping:
  • addGlobal(ModuleRef, TypeRef, cstring)

Examples:

let
  module = newModule("main")
  Int64 = intType(64)
  global = module.newGlobal(Int64, "a")
assert global.kind == GlobalVariableValueKind

  • createBasicBlockInContext(ContextRef, cstring)
proc appendBasicBlock(fn: FunctionValue; name: string; cxt: Context = nil): BasicBlock {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}

Append a basic block to the end of a function using a specific context. If cxt is nil, using the global context.

Wrapping:

  • appendBasicBlock(ValueRef, cstring)
proc newBuilder(cxt: Context = nil): Builder {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

An instruction builder represents a point within a basic block and is the exclusive means of building instructions using the C interface.

Wrapping:

  • createBuilderInContext(ContextRef)
  • createBuilder()
